intro: Premna siamensis, commonly known as Siam nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. Its fruit is a small, hairy capsule that contains several seeds. Premna siamensis is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
